column2: New developments prohibited; improvements to existing structures are permitted with public hearing. Buildings must be proven to not increase flooding by more than 1 foot in the community, and structures to be substantially improved must be elevated to 1 foot above base flood elevation; full list of development standards found in Section VII of Flood Hazard Bylaws.
column4: PUD permitted uses are the uses permitted in the proposed districts
column6: PUD permitted uses are the uses permitted in the proposed districts
column8: Lot size can be waived to no less than 1 acre provided that overall permittable density on the lot stays the same (according to table 7.1)
column10: Administrative officer/board of approval must find that any new development in the DWA has minimized impacts on deer wintering. Administrative officer approval when only a zoning permit is needed for development and BOA when conditional use (public hearing) is needed.
column16: Any changes to existing structures must be approved by the planning commission, including additions, alterations, demolition, and relocation of the structure. Change of use/occupancy and routine repairs not affecting the outside of the structure do not require approval. Specific details found in Section 3.13 of bylaws.
column20: The overlay consists of designated wetlands and 50' surrounding the wetlands. Any development w/in this overlay must be issued a state wetlands permit prior to construction.
column22: Mapped as the "source protection area". Nonresidential uses are restricted in this overlay to protect drinking water quality, but residential uses are unaffected.
